[TTT: KPI Claim Verification Framework]

COMMON MFI SOFTWARE KPI CLAIMS:

1. TURNAROUND TIME (TAT):
   - Marketing claim pattern: "Reduce loan approval from 5 days to 2 hours"
   - Verification: Requires before/after data from specific customer
   - INTEGRITY CHECK: Ask for timestamped audit trail from production system
   - INFERENCE FORMULA: If claimed TAT improvement unverified:
     Industry average improvement: 40-60% reduction typical
     Maximum credible: 90% reduction (5 days â†’ 12 hours)
     Over 90%: Requires exceptional evidence

2. PORTFOLIO AT RISK (PAR):
   - Marketing claim pattern: "Reduce PAR30 from 8% to 3%"
   - Verification: Requires loan performance data (sensitive)
   - INTEGRITY CHECK: PAR improvements take 6-12 months to materialize
   - INFERENCE FORMULA:
     Industry average PAR30 for African MFIs: 5-10%
     Software impact range: 10-30% reduction typical
     Claims of >50% PAR reduction: Requires cohort analysis

3. OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY:
   - Marketing claim pattern: "Handle 3x more loans with same staff"
   - Verification: Requires headcount and loan volume data
   - INTEGRITY CHECK: Staff may have been reassigned, not eliminated
   - INFERENCE FORMULA:
     Typical automation uplift: 20-40% efficiency gain
     Claims of >100% gain: Requires process redesign evidence

4. CUSTOMER ACQUISITION COST (CAC):
   - Marketing claim pattern: "Reduce CAC by 60%"
   - Verification: Requires marketing spend and customer data
   - INTEGRITY CHECK: CAC reduction may reflect maturation, not software
   - INFERENCE FORMULA:
     Digital channel CAC vs field: typically 40-70% lower
     Software-attributed CAC reduction: 10-25% credible range

KPI VERIFICATION CHECKLIST FOR BUYER:

[ ] Request 3 reference customers for calls
[ ] Ask for anonymized before/after metrics
[ ] Verify timeline (when deployed vs when metrics measured)
[ ] Check for confounding factors (market conditions, staffing changes)
[ ] Request production system audit trail access
[ ] Compare claims to industry benchmarks

OVERALL KPI CONFIDENCE (Without Direct Access): VERY LOW

Most fintech marketing KPIs are:
- Cherry-picked from best customers
- Measured at favorable timepoints
- Missing denominator context
- Not independently audited

BUYER RECOMMENDATION:
Do not trust ANY KPI claim without:
1. Named customer reference
2. Before/after data with dates
3. Independent verification method

CERTAINTY: Very Low (framework only, no actual KPI data)
